sentences.en: A compromise may break the deadlock between the union and management.
sentences.cn: 妥协也许能打破劳资双方所处的僵局.

sentences.en: A deadlock was reached in the discussions, as neither side would give way to the other.
sentences.cn: 讨论陷入僵局, 因为双方各不相让.

sentences.en: a last-ditch effort to break the deadlock
A penalty by Thierry Lacroix broke the deadlock in the dying minutes of the game.
sentences.cn: 蒂里·拉克鲁瓦的点球在比赛结束前的最后时刻打破了僵局。

sentences.en: European agriculture ministers failed to break the deadlock over farm subsidies.
sentences.cn: 欧洲各国农业部长在农业补贴问题上未能打破僵局。

sentences.en: He's brought things to a deadlock.
New proposals have been put forward to break the deadlock among rival factions.
sentences.cn: 旨在结束各竞争派别之间僵持局面的新提案已被提交。

sentences.en: Peace talks between the two sides ended in deadlock last month.
sentences.cn: 双方上个月的和平谈判陷入了僵局。

sentences.en: The negotiations came to a deadlock.
The negotiations have come to a deadlock.
The negotiations reached a deadlock after two hours.
sentences.cn: 两小时后,谈判陷入了僵局.

sentences.en: The talks have reached a complete deadlock .
The two parties have come to a deadlock.
There was this deadlock of passion between them, and she was stronger.
sentences.cn: 两人就这样僵持着, 她占了上风.

sentences.en: There was this deadlock of passion between them.
They called for a compromise on all sides to break the deadlock in the world trade talks.
sentences.cn: 他们呼吁各方作出让步以打破世界贸易谈判中的僵局。

sentences.en: What if relations between you and your neighbour have reached deadlock, and their behaviour is still unacceptable?
sentences.cn: 如果你和你的邻居已闹僵了，而他们的行为还是令人难以接受，那怎么办？

trans.tran_en: a situation in which a disagreement cannot be settled
